          PC Auto Shutdown&#039;, as the producer claims, is suppose to help you 
          shutdown, power off, reboot, hibernate, suspend or log off your 
          computer at a scheduled time. You have a lot of options to configure 
          the program. You can configure hotkeys to help you work faster with 
          it or &#039;Clean up&#039; options to perform some clean up tasks, during the 
          shutdown action, like clear Recycle Bin, clear cookies of Internet 
          Explorer, clear temporary file folder of Windows or clear browser 
                         history of Internet Explorer.                
                                                                      
          When testing the program I&#039;ve tried to schedule a shutdown action 
          but, instead of providing a positive number for the countdown 
          duration, I deliberately inserted a negative value. This number 
          should represent the seconds until the computer performs the selected 
          action. The provided number was &#039;-30&#039; (seconds), but, as soon as I 
          clicked the &#039;OK&#039; button a timer appeared to show me how much do I 
          have to wait until the selected action is performed. When I 
          transformed this amount of seconds into years seams that I have to 
          wait more than 100 years for my computer to perform the selected 
                                    action.                           
                                                                      
          You have a sound option which, according to the hint displayed in the 
          &#039;Sound&#039; window, will work only when &#039;the shutdown action is 
          activated&#039;, and a password option in order to set a password to 
           prevent other users from changing the shutdown settings.
